name: vscode-docker
description: Adds syntax highlighting, commands, hover tips, and linting for Dockerfile and docker-compose files.

appFolder.description: Path to the folder for the application.

appOutput.description: Path to the output assembly for the application.

appProject.description: Path to the application project file.

dockerBuild.description: Options for building the Docker image used for debugging.

args.description: Build arguments applied to the Docker image used for debugging.

context.description: Path to the Docker build context.

dockerfile.description: Path to the Dockerfile used for the build.

labels.description: Labels applied to the Docker image used for debugging.

tag.description: Tag applied to the Docker image used for debugging.

target.description: Docker build target (stage) used for debugging.

dockerRun.description: Options for running the Docker container used for debugging.

containerName.description: Name of the container used for debugging.

env.description: Environment variables applied to the Docker container used for debugging.

envFiles.description: Files of environment variables read in and applied to the Docker container used for debugging.

labels.description: Labels applied to the Docker container used for debugging.

network.description: The network to which the container will be connected.

networkAlias.description: The network-scoped alias to assign to the container.

ports.description: Ports that are going to be mapped on the host.

hostPort.description: Port number to be bound on the host.

containerPort.description: Port number of the container to be bound.

protocol.description: Specific protocol for the binding (`tcp | udp`).

extraHosts.description: Hosts to be added to the container's `hosts` file for DNS resolution.

volumes.description: Volumes that are going to be mapped to the container.

localPath.description: Path on local machine that will be mapped. The folder will be created if it does not exist.

containerPath.description: Path where the volume will be mapped within the container. The folder will be created if it does not exist.

permissions.description: Permissions for the container for the mapped volume, `rw` for read-write or `ro` for read-only.

docker.defaultRegistryPath.description: Default registry and path when tagging an image

docker.groupImagesBy.description: How to group items in the treeview Images node

docker.imageBuildContextPath.description: Build context PATH to pass to Docker build command

docker.truncateLongRegistryPaths.description: Truncate long Image and Container registry paths in the Explorer

docker.truncateMaxLength.description: Maximum number of characters for long registry paths in the Explorer, including elipsis

docker.host.description: Full host address to connect to (with protocol). Equivalent to setting the DOCKER_HOST environment variable

useCertificateStore.description: On Mac and Windows, indicates whether to automatically import certificates from the system certificate store. Ignored on Linux.

certificatePaths.description: Paths to files or folders containing certificates to import. For Linux, the correct path to pick up system-wide certificates will depend on the distribution.

docker.importCertificates.description: True causes the extension to attempt to find system-wide certificates, false indicates that the default Node.js trusted certificates list will be used. Use an object to get more fine-grained control.

docker.languageserver.diagnostics.deprec.description: Controls the diagnostic severity for the deprecated MAINTAINER instruction

docker.languageserver.diagnostics.emptyC.description: Controls the diagnostic severity for flagging empty continuation lines found in instructions that span multiple lines

docker.languageserver.diagnostics.direct.description: Controls the diagnostic severity for parser directives that are not written in lowercase

docker.languageserver.diagnostics.instru.description: Controls the diagnostic severity for instructions that are not written in uppercase
Controls the diagnostic severity for flagging a Dockerfile with multiple CMD instructions
Controls the diagnostic severity for flagging a Dockerfile with multiple ENTRYPOINT instructions
Controls the diagnostic severity for flagging a Dockerfile with multiple HEALTHCHECK instructions
Controls the diagnostic severity for JSON instructions that are written incorrectly with single quotes
Controls the diagnostic severity for WORKDIR instructions that do not point to an absolute path

docker.attachShellCommand.linuxContainer.description: Attach command to use for Linux containers

docker.attachShellCommand.windowsContain.description: Attach command to use for Windows containers

docker.promptOnSystemPrune.description: Prompt for confirmation when running System Prune command

docker.dockerComposeBuild.description: Run docker-compose with the --build argument, defaults to true

docker.dockerComposeDetached.description: Run docker-compose with the --d (detached) argument, defaults to true

docker.imageFirst.description: When displaying containers, show the image first if true, otherwise show the container name first; defaults to true

commands.title: Deploy Image to Azure App Service...

scripts.pretest: npm run build && npm run webpack
scripts.all: npm i && npm run lint && npm test
scripts.webpack-profile: webpack --profile --json --mode production > webpack-stats.json && echo Use http://webpack.github.io/analyse to analyze the stats
